content.description: A <math alttext="9 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> battery, a resistor, and a capacitor are connected in series as shown above. The values of the resistance and capacitance are not known. The switch is closed at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The current is measured for a few seconds, and the data are recorded in the chart below. Which of the following claims is supported by the data?
content.question: <math alttext="t, in seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>(</mo><mtext>s</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="I, in amperes" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>(</mo><mtext>A</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.33" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.33</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: The capacitor is being charged, and the resistor has a resistance of <math alttext="3 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.<math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
The capacitor is being charged, and the resistor has a resistance of <math alttext="27 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The capacitor is being discharged, and the resistor has a resistance of <math alttext="3 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The capacitor is being discharged, and the resistor has a resistance of <math alttext="27 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
None of these claims can be made without knowing the capacitance of the capacitor.

content.answer: The capacitor is being charged, and the resistor has a resistance of <math alttext="3 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.<math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
